intro: Calyptrogyne costatifrons subsp. dariensis, commonly known as the Darien calyptrogyne, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive foliage and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along riverbanks and in dense forest understories. Its leaves are usually opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are clustered in whorled arrangements and are often brightly colored, attracting various pollinators.
